item.name: Maling list

query.description: Possible values:  Name , Subject , Status , DeliveredOn , CreatedOn .

request.description: Gets a list of your active mailing lists in your account.

item.name: Getting all active mailing lists with paging

query.description: Possible values:  Name , Subject , Status , DeliveredOn , CreatedOn .

request.description: Gets a list of your active mailing lists in your account. Because the results for this call could be quite big, paging information is required as input.
Gets details for a given mailing list. You may include subscriber statistics in your results or not. Any segments existing for the requested mailing list will not be included in the results.
Creates a new empty mailing list in your account.
Updates the properties of an existing mailing list.
Deletes a mailing list from your account.
Creates a new custom field in the specified mailing list.
Updates the properties of an existing custom field in the specified mailing list.
Removes a custom field definition from the specified mailing list.

item.description: Through the Moosend Mailing List API you can create new lists, subscribe new users to your existing lists, manage segments and create or delete custom fields. It also supports fetching list statistics such as the number of active vs unsubscribed members, as well as retrieving subscriber information for a specific mailing list.

item.name: Subscribers

variable.description: Possible values:  Subscribed , Unsubscribed , Bounced , Removed .

request.description: Gets a list of all subscribers in a given mailing list. You may filter the list by setting a date to fetch those subscribed since then and/or by their status. Because the results for this call could be quite big, paging information is required as input.
Searches for a subscriber with the specified email address in the specified mailing list and returns detailed information such as id, name, date created, date unsubscribed, status and custom fields
Searches for a subscriber with the specified unique id in the specified mailing list and returns detailed information such as email, name, date created, date unsubscribed, status and custom fields.

Adds a new subscriber to the specified mailing list. If there is already a subscriber with the specified email address in the list, an update will be performed instead. The rate limit for this request is 10 requests per 10 seconds (\*per API key).

This method allows you to add multiple subscribers in a mailing list with a single call. If some subscribers already exist with the given email addresses, they will be updated. If you try to add a subscriber with an invalid email address, this attempt will be ignored, as the process will skip to the next subscriber automatically. The rate limit for this request is 2 requests per 10 seconds (\*per API key).
Updates a subscriber in the specified mailing list.
Unsubscribes a subscriber from the account. The rate limit for this request is 20 requests per 10 seconds (\*per API key).
Unsubscribes a subscriber from the specified mailing list. The rate limit for this request is 20 requests per 10 seconds (\*per API key).

item.name: Unsubscribing subscribers from mailing list and a specified campaign

request.description: Unsubscribes a subscriber from the specified mailing list and the specified campaign. This call will take into account the setting you have in "unsubscribe settings" and will remove the subscriber from all other mailing lists or not accordingly. The rate limit for this request is 20 requests per 10 seconds (\*per API key).
Removes a subscriber from the specified mailing list permanently (without moving to the suppression list).
Removes a list of subscribers from the specified mailing list permanently (without putting them in the suppression list). Any invalid email addresses specified will be ignored.

item.description: Through the Moosend Subscriber API you can add or remove mailing list subscribers, fetch and update their information and batch import new subscribers.

request.description: Returns a list of all campaigns in your account with detailed information. Because the results for this call could be quite big, paging information is required as input.
Returns a list of all campaigns in your account with detailed information. Because the results for this call could be quite big, paging information is required as input.

item.name: Get Campaigns by Page and Pagesize

query.description: Possible values:  Name , Subject , Status , DeliveredOn , CreatedOn .

request.description: Returns a complete set of properties that describe the requested campaign in detail. No statistics are included in the result.
Gets a list of your active senders in your account. You may specify any email address of these senders when sending a campaign.
Returns basic information for the specified sender identified by its email address.

request.description: Creates an exact copy of an existing campaign. The new campaign is created as a draft.

Creates a new campaign in your account. This method does not send the campaign, but rather creates it as a draft, ready for sending or testing. You can choose to send either a regular campaign or an AB split campaign. Campaign content must be specified from a web location. Ignore _**(A/B Split Campaign Option)**_ if you want to create a regular campaign.
Sends a test email of a draft campaign to a list of email addresses you specify for previewing.
Sends an existing draft campaign to all recipients specified in its mailing list. The campaign is sent immediatelly.

variable.description: Possible values:  Sent , Opened , LinkClicked , Forward , Unsubscribed , Bounced .

request.description: Returns a detailed list of statistics for a given campaign based on activity such as emails sent, opened, bounced, link clicked, etc. Because the results for this call could be quite big, paging information is required as input.

item.name: Get Campaign Statistics With Paging & Filtered

variable.description: Possible values:  Sent , Opened , LinkClicked , Forward , Unsubscribed , Bounced , Complained .

request.description: Returns a detailed list of statistics for a given campaign based on activity such as emails sent, opened, bounced, link clicked, etc. Because the results for this call could be quite big, paging information is required as input.
Provides a basic summary of the results for any sent campaign such as the number of recipients, opens, clicks, bounces, unsubscribes, forwards etc. to date.
Returns a detailed report of your campaign opens (unique and total) by country.
Returns a detailed report of your campaign opens (unique and total) by country.

Assigns a scheduled date and time at which the campaign will be delivered.

- `Timezone` : The timezone the specified date and time refers to. By default the timezone in your settings panel will be used. If specified, one of the following values must be used. _**(Optional)**_

Removes a previously defined scheduled date and time from a campaign, so that it will be delivered immediately if already queued or when sent.

Provides a basic summary of the results for a sent AB test campaign, separately for each version (A and B), such as the number of recipients, opens, clicks, bounces, unsubscribes, forwards etc to date.

item.name: Segments

request.description: Gets detailed information on a specific segment and its criteria. However, it does not include the subscribers returned by the segment.
Gets a list of the subscribers that the specified segment returns according to its criteria. Because the results for this call could be quite big, paging information is required as input.
Creates a new empty segment (without criteria) for the given mailing list. You may specify the name of the segment and the way the criteria will match together.

Creates a new segment (with criteria) for the given mailing list. You may specify the name of the segment, the way the criteria will match together and the criteria that you wish to segment your list by.
Deletes a segment along with its criteria from the mailing list. The subscribers of the mailing list that the segment returned are not deleted or affected in any way.

item.description: The Segmentation Service allows you to retrieve or count mailing list members based on given criteria. Combinations of criteria can be as complex as you want with nested AND / OR expressions.
